reviewText: great compilation of Christmas classics.  Loved the oldies but goodies and having a great time exposing my little one to what cartoons were once like.

Well, here I go--spoiling my great-grandson Devon again! Ever since I first saw Devon sitting on the floor of his home watching cartoons--all wide-eyed with "little boy wonderment"--I've been buying him a variety of cartoons. From Toy Story 3 to Disney versions of such classics as Pinocchio (Walt Disney's Masterpiece), Devon has a good collection. It was a natural selection at Christmas to buy him this collection of classic Christmas cartoons. TV Christmas Cartoons contains eleven of my favorites; I won't name them all since Amazon lists them in the product description. Instead I'll list Devon's favorites, the ones his mother tells me he watches repeatedly: 1. Jack Frost 2. The Star of Bethlehem 3. The Shanty Where Santy Claus Lives It does my heart good when his mother paints a vivid picture of him sitting there, giggling and giggling. Is there a more pleasant sound in the world than a child's laughter? A babbling brook comes close... I know how obsessed adults can be about high-definition resolution and perfection of film, but that doesn't matter to kids, so it doesn't matter to me in this case. What makes Devon happy, makes Grammy happy. Is it any wonder I spoil him? Highly recommended... And I'm laughing all the way to the bank because the price is so reasonable, making it easier to buy him more. Reviewed by Betty Dravis, January 10, 2011 Author of "The Toonies Invade Silicon Valley"

I love this collection of Christmas cartoons and watch it every year.  At first I was unsure of what would arrive in the mail because the cover of the DVD looks elementary but this DVD did not disappoint.  It is now a tradition. It would be nice if it was slightly longer.  You have to keep in mind that these are vintage cartoons and not in the HD that we have become accustom to- but that is also why I love it.  It arrive promptly and in excellent condition.  I had paid less than $4 and find it as an excellent deal.
Great collection of cartoons from childhood! Forgot how sad some of these are! I Wish the quality was better though.
I really love the cartoons form the 20's and 30's they are fun to watch beautiful and full of imagination Thank you for making these wonderful cartoons available.

Good Christmas cartoons for the kids. Not much of an upgrade. Picture needs work. But it's okay..

Dee Smalls
Decatur GA

My brother would laugh until his laughter became a barely audible squeeking.  It was usually a "roadie cyote" but any cartoon where the villan is outsmated was hillarity.  This has become a favorite gift:  cartoons from Lin.

Growing up, my sisters and I had a VHS with Christmas Comes But Once a Year. It was a Christmas tradition to watch it. I found this DVD which had that cartoon plus many others and had to purchase one for each of my sisters.
Have not watched yet to see if they are what I as looking for, so not sure about them. Will watch when I get time.
I MISSED SEEING THESE AS A CHILD BECAUSE I DID NOT HAVE A TV UNTIL I WAS IN MY TEEN YEARS.  NOW I CAN WATCH THEM ALL OF THE TIME.

For those of us who grew up with this type of cartoons, there is no substitute for holiday go back in time toons. Just having these on in the  background while you deal with holiday stress events, will calm you down a bit.
Great old Xmas cartoons I enjoyed when I was a kid and now my kids are enjoying the same images of Xmas Cartoons from my childhood.

I had seen this before & wanted to have one of my own. It is delightful and continues to appeal to both 6 year olds & sixty year olds! I firmly believe that the "old" cartoons are far more entertaining than new ones.

Great retro cartoons! This will bring back memories of early TV to so many! Fun to have on while wrapping gifts or enjoying a swank cocktail party. Kids and adults alike will enjoy this collection of classics!
My daughter wanted this because she remembers watching these cartoons as a child.  She was happy I found it.
Poor

Same recycled cartoons, however, all are great to visit during the season.  Unfortunately, the quality is so poor. They made no effort to restore or clean up the copies.  Stay clear of releases by the studio "Echo Bridge Home Entertainment".  They have several DVD releases with the same clips.  There's a youtube channel dedicated to only vintage Christmas cartoons and movies called "XmasFlix".  Check it out. Quality is so much better.  I have yet to find a dvd collection that is good quality.  Too bad.
love watching this dvd
Absolutely LOVE this product! It's got almost all of the old shows I used to watch as a kid!
ITS GREAT FOR CHILDREN
